Job Title: Senior Director, Media Analytics

Location: Burbank, CA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Analyst, Information Technology, Research

Description:
Overview

The Company 

Hearts & Science has been inspired by confident marketers seeking business advantage in a world of personalized digital marketing, where CRM and addressable channels converge, and decisions must be made in real time to aggregate effective reach and deliver the right message at the right time.

Designed to inform brand strategies with real-time insights, Hearts & Science is a data-driven marketing agency with expert media planning and buying capabilities, among other services that include shopper marketing, marketing innovation and content activation.

Senior Director, Media Analytics

As the Senior Director at Hearts & Science you will serve as a senior media analytics and insights leader for a key Heart & Science theatrical entertainment client, overseeing all day-to-day data and analytics deliverables as well as serve as the key point of contact for clients on all things concerning marketing science, reporting and optimization. You will ensure key business constituents understand drivers of performance, help them finds growth levers, and identify opportunities for optimization. You will also lead the business through all efforts that drive analytics performance and potential by using existing and new data sources, techniques and automation solutions. You’ll come up with solutions to tough analytical problems and deliver strategic insights for the business, reporting to the Executive Director, Marketing Science with accountability to overall account leadership.

Qualifications

10+ years of experience at a Media agency, marketing analytics or data-driven field with a focus on media measurement use casesExcellent communication and presentation skills are a must, with the ability to simplify complex concepts for a broad audienceExcellent strategic thinker who is willing to take risks and challenge the status quoStrong leader who can demonstrate analytic skills, problem solving, and independent decision makingExperience with Upper- and Mid-Funnel media decision frameworks and KPI’s. Performance media experience desirableFamiliarity with marketing technology (e.g., Data Management Platforms, API-driven conversion measurement), ad-serving (e.g., Google DCM), and web analytics tools (e.g., Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics)Familiarity with media publisher measurement capabilities (e.g. DV360, Meta, Snapchat, YouTube)Experience applying marketing mix modeling/econometric analysis and/or other branches of market research to media applicationsEntertainment and Theatrical experience are a plus


Responsibilities

Leadership/Support Role

Management and prioritization of the business’s overall analytical needs and opportunitiesDefines the business questions that need be answered, identifies appropriate analytical solutions in addition to identifying and readying relevant data sources for analysisManage and develop staff in learning best practices, and improving speed and accuracy of reports as well as ad hoc analytics deliverablesLead client analytics discussions involving reporting, optimization, and recommendations for improving performancePartner with client internal analytical teams to work towards common business outcomes, providing and asking for support proactively when necessary 


Analytics Strategy

Attend senior level client meetings and actively participate in the preparation and presentationActively engaged with the clients and play a leading role in strategy development regarding the collection, manipulation, and analysis of data across various LOB’s and departments such as investment, strategy, and digital audience planningCreate new data-driven approaches for the purpose of generating business insights through data analytics, information visualization, and addressing unanswered business issues in a proactive manner


Analytics

Play a key role in development and application of analytical algorithms, solutions, and methods where possible with a view of driving and enhancing data systems and streamlining business processesStrives to improve the quality of analytics solutions on a consistent basis and ensuring delivery of high-quality deliverables for all functions of the business and in the definition of metrics that track the business’s performance at different fronts


Collaboration

You are highly collaborative and, as such, you will facilitate joint brainstorming and team collaboration across different internal teams (such as strategy, investment and creative) and externally with clientsWork closely with central agency analytics team in establishing departmental goals and strategies, as well as collaborates with numerous departments across the business, aiding them in the proper use of data and analytics outputs


Automation/Reporting

Ensure the most appropriate automation solutions, internal and external, are evaluated, implemented, and streamlined where necessary, to ensure business efficiency and enable cross-departmental engagementPartner with offshore reporting and database group to develop solutions which increase automation and efficiency for onshore marketing science team members


Compensation Range: $150,000 - $200,000 annually. This is the pay range the Company believes it will pay for this position at the time of this posting. Consistent with applicable law, compensation will be determined based on relevant experience, other job-related qualifications/skills, and geographic location (to account for comparative cost of living). The Company reserves the right to modify this pay range at any time. For this role, Benefits include: health insurance, vision insurance, dental insurance, 401(k), Healthcare Flexible Spending Account, Dependent Care Flexible Spending Account, vacation, sick, personal days, paid parental leave, and paid medical leave, STD/LTD insurance benefits.

Hearts & Science is An Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status, age or any other federally protected class.

Experience Level (if available): Director
